article:
Years ago in Scotland, the Clark family had a dream. Clark and his wife worked and saved,  _  plans for their nine children and themselves to  _  to the United States. It had taken years, but they had finally  _  enough money and had gotten passports and reservations for the  _  family on a new liner to the United States.
The entire family was  _  with excitement about their new life. However, seven days before their  _  , the youngest son was bitten by a dog. The doctor sewed up the boy  _  hung a yellow sheet on the Clarks' front door.  Because of  the possibility of rabies  , they were being quarantined  for fourteen days.
The family's dreams were dashed. They would not be able to make the trip to America  _  they had planned. Watching the ship leave  _  his family, the father, filled with disappointment and anger, cursed both his son and God for their  _  .
Five days later, the tragic news spread  _  Scotland---the mighty Titanic had sunk. The  _  ship had sunk, taking hundreds of lives with it. The Clark family  was to  have been on that ship, but because the son had been bitten by a dog, they were left  _  
When Mr. Clark heard the news, he hugged his son and thanked him for  _  the family. He thanked God  _  saving their lives and turning what he had left was a tragedy into a  _  .
Although we may not  always  understand, all things happen for a  _  .
